title: Jo Swinson says Brexit deal will damage British economy – video
text:
The Liberal Democrat leader responded to Boris Johnson’s statement on his Brexit deal, saying it would damage the British economy ‘on a scale greater than the financial crash’. She also accused the prime minister of dismissing a people’s vote out of fear that the public would ‘reject this bad deal and choose to remain in the EU'.

Johnson responded by saying the deal would not remove workers’ rights and accused Swinson of not allowing the British public a say on the deal by preventing a general election
description: The Liberal Democrat leader demanded a people's vote and warned the Brexit deal would damage the British economy ‘on a scale greater than the financial crash'
